column4: hi folks! nautilus won't show thumbnails, even though I've already installed thumbnailers. What can I do to fix it?
delete ~/.thumbnails/fail/ (you often need to restart your session as well after installing thumbnailers)
I tried it, but it didn't work.
tried which, both?
I tried it previously.
deleting the fail folder and restarting
which thumbnailer?
trim: and reinstalling the thumbnailers
trim: ffmpegthumbnailer and mplayerthumbnailer
where did you install them from, maybe they aren't updated properly, the argument format changed slightly in 11.10 or 12.04
check /usr/share/thumbnailers/
i'll do it.
I can see 4 text files each one for a different thumbnailer
including totem.thumbnailer
see if any of them use %u, I think it changed to %i

hmm, maybe that doesn't really matter, which thumbnailers are in /usr/share/thumbnailers/ ? I seem to already have three by default, maybe you just need to write a .thumbnailer file for ffmpeg and mplayer
yes, they use %u
then I'll write a thumbnailer file for ffmpeg
I notice totem still uses %u so that must be okay
I changed my zip thumbnailer to %i for some reason, been a while since I messed with it
I'll write a .thumbnailer for ffmpeg and see what happens
thanks
alright, good luck
